thig10.1:6.1_0: “I was on the road and about to give birth.,
thig10.1:6.2_0: when I saw my husband dead.
thig10.1:6.3_0: I gave birth there on the road
thig10.1:6.4_0: before I’d reached my own house.
thig10.1:7.2_0: and on the road my husband lies dead—oh woe is me!
thig10.1:7.4_0: all burning up on the same pyre.”
thig10.1:8.1_0: “Oh woe is you whose family is lost,
thig10.1:9.2_0: I saw my son’s flesh being eaten.
thig10.1:9.3_0: With my family destroyed, condemned by all,
thig10.1:9.4_0: and my husband dead, I realized the deathless.
